official-title.#text: To establish the National Commission on the Structure of the Army, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Commission on the Structure of the Army Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Limitation on availability of funds for reductions to the Army National Guard

text.#text: None of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2015 for the Army may be used to divest, retire, or transfer, or prepare to divest, retire, or transfer, any aircraft of the Army assigned to units of the Army National Guard as of January 15, 2014.

None of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2015 for the Army may be used to reduce personnel below the authorized end strength levels of 350,000 for the Army National Guard as of September 30, 2014.

header.#text: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (in this Act referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Commission on the Structure of the Army
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

text.#text: There is established the
The Commission shall be composed of eight members, of whom—
four shall be appointed by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Armed Services of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Armed Services of the House of Representatives.

text.#text: one shall be appointed by the Ranking Member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be made not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.

text.#text: If one or more appointments under

header.#text: Effect of lack of appointment by appointment date

text.#text: In making appointments under this subsection, consideration should be given to individuals with expertise in reserve forces policy.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . Any vacancy in the Commission shall not affect its powers, but shall be filled in the same manner as the original appointment.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

text.#text: Members shall be appointed for the life of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: have been appointed, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall hold its first meeting.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

text.#text: Not later than 30 days after the date on which all members of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall meet at the call of the Chair.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall constitute a quorum, but a lesser number of members may hold hearings.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

text.#text: A majority of the members of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall select a Chair and Vice Chair from among its members.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall undertake a comprehensive study of the structure of the Army to determine the proper force mixture of the active component and reserve component, and how the structure should be modified to best fulfill current and anticipated mission requirements for the Army in a manner consistent with available resources and estimated future resources.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall give particular consideration to evaluating a structure that—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

text.#text: In considering the structure of the Army, the
meets current and anticipated requirements of the combatant commands;

achieves a cost-efficiency balance between the regular and reserve components of the Army, taking advantage of the unique strengths and capabilities of each, with a particular focus on fully burdened and lifecycle cost of Army personnel;
ensures that the regular and reserve components of the Army have the capacity needed to support current and anticipated homeland defense and disaster assistance missions in the United States;
provides for sufficient numbers of regular members of the Army to provide a base of trained personnel from which the personnel of the reserve components of the Army could be recruited;
maintains a peacetime rotation force to support operational tempo goals of 1:2 for regular members of the Army and 1:5 for members of the reserve components of the Army; and
maximizes and appropriately balances affordability, efficiency, effectiveness, capability, and readiness.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the congressional defense committees a report which shall contain a detailed statement of the findings and conclusions of the
as a result of the study required by
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , together with its recommendations for such legislation and administrative actions it may consider appropriate in light of the results of the study.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army Act of 2014/s:4/ss:a

text.#text: Not later than February 1, 2016, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may hold such hearings, sit and act at such times and places, take such testimony, and receive such evidence as the Commission considers advisable to carry out this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may secure directly from any Federal department or agency such information as the Commission considers necessary to carry out this Act. Upon request of the Chair of the Commission, the head of such department or agency shall furnish such information to the Commission.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may use the United States mails in the same manner and under the same conditions as other departments and agencies of the Federal Government.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may accept, use, and dispose of gifts or donations of services or property.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: who is not an officer or employee of the Federal Government shall be compensated at a rate equal to the daily equivalent of the annual rate of basic pay prescribed for level IV of the Executive Schedule under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , for each day (including travel time) during which such member is engaged in the performance of the duties of the Commission. All members of the Commission who are officers or employees of the United States shall serve without compensation in addition to that received for their services as officers or employees of the United States.

text.#text: Each member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be allowed travel expenses, including per diem in lieu of subsistence, at rates authorized for employees of agencies under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: while away from their homes or regular places of business in the performance of services for the Commission.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: usc-chapter/5,UnitedStatesCode,/57/I

text.#text: The members of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may, without regard to the civil service laws and regulations, appoint and terminate an executive director and such other additional personnel as may be necessary to enable the Commission to perform its duties. The employment of an executive director shall be subject to confirmation by the Commission.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may fix the compensation of the executive director and other personnel without regard to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: usc-chapter/5/51

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , relating to classification of positions and General Schedule pay rates, except that the rate of pay for the executive director and other personnel may not exceed the rate payable for level V of the Executive Schedule under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: usc-chapter/5/53/III

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: without reimbursement, and such detail shall be without interruption or loss of civil service status or privilege.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Commission on the Structure of the Army
